content: My funding source has asked me for a list of IGs that have been or are being developed using FHIR Shorthand. If you are using FSH, could you do me a favor and list your IG here?

• HLA Reporting IG, 1st draft (http://fhir.b12x.org/ig/hla-reporting, this is a temporary home)
  • started development of CIBMTR Reporting IG (only contains Patient profile)

4 in New Zealand at present - likely more to come.
Also the primary care project in Australia

Mark Kramer said:

developed using FHIR Shorthand

do you mean
a) developed using only shorthand/sushi
b) developed using other tools and at some point including fsh(for some part, big or small)
?

My org is not using them for IGs as we are still mainly STU3, but we are using FSH to generate our terminology before we load it to our terminology server. When we start our R4 IGs it will be FSH all the way.
I am experimenting within IHE with the use of sushi. The IHE-MHD profile is my target, so here is my FSH based MHD IG https://github.com/JohnMoehrke/MHD-fsh
@Keith Boone has done many of them.

Public Health's Birth Defect Reporting FHIR IG
Public Health's Immunization Decision Support FHIR IG
Working on the Argonaut Subscriptions IG (R5 Backport to R4). If it goes well, will probably use it for Argonaut Subscription Encounters IG as well.

@Mark Kramer if you mean "done only with shorthand/sushi" I thinkt there is an experimental one I know of
If you mean "that uses sushi for bootstrapping the effort or creating examples" - I have quite a few more..
I'm doing one for Subscriptions for Carequality (not published yet)
Any IG that used or is using FSH and SUSHI in any part of development

1. Belgium / Flanders project for primary care coordination used shorthand/sushi for creating examples
  2. HL7 Belgium project on MedicationDispense used Sushi for starting 1 profile and will use it for creating examples
  3. Belgian National Institute for Health Insurance is using sushi for examples and used it for first versions of a few profiles, extensions and terminology resources
  4. Belgium / Limburg project for digital health is using sushi to create examples (profiles had already been defined)
  5. IHE Pharmacy will probably create some profiles may use sushi to create first draft profiles and most likely will examples on (I'm still sharpening the tools)
  6. Probably a few other projects that are not using sushi will do so once we start creating examples.
    7 There is experimentation ongoing in a Federal institute

This is the list of official projects I can think of now

Parts of the MIRACUM Core IG (https://fhir.miracum.org/core/) were created with FSH/SUSHI. MIRACUM (https://www.miracum.org/) is one of the consortia in the German Medical Informatics Initative (https://www.medizininformatik-initiative.de/en/start).

Here's what I've been able to compile so far. Please check it over and I apologize in advance if I have omitted or misrepresented your work in any way. Also, you might see your name at the bottom of the list if you have been on this channel, but I didn't have details of your project. @Jean Duteau and @David Hay can you add your projects? Shorthand-IG-Survey-May-2020.docx
@Mark Kramer, I've recently started converting some Canada Core profiles to FSH as a "proof of concept" and plan to propose converting the entire Canada Core at some point.
@Mark Kramer My organization should be MIRACUM to avoid confusion, since the Medical Informatics Initative also has seperate IGs.

Application Data Exchange Assessment Framework and Functional Requirements for Mobile Health at http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-project-mhealth/
IHE ACDC Implementation Guide at http://build.fhir.org/ig/IHE/ACDC/branches/master/
Situational Awareness for Novel Epidemic Response at http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/fhir-saner/
HL7 Version 2 to FHIR at http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/v2-to-fhir/branches/master/index.html

Basically, every IG I've worked on for the past year.
Thank you everyone for your responses.

Mark - I missed this while I was travelling across the country. Here are my current guides that I am using FSH on:
1) IBM FDA BEST Project ICSR Guide
2) HL7 Pharmacy Medication List Guidance
3) Da Vinci Prior Authorization Support Guide (just converted this from non-FSH to FSH this week)
4) British Columbia Provider Registry Project

Like Keith, any IG that I'm working on now or in the future.
Some great FSH references here. Is there a central place (Confluence?) that these can be collated, with links to repos (if they are public)

That is a great idea, @Richard Kavanagh . I started a page listing all the FSH-based IG projects on Confluence: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FSH-Based+Implementation+Guides. Feel free to edit the page (everyone here).
